Pre-Game Insights: India will look to be on top of its game in all three departments while the hosts would want their middle-order to fire
The penchant for having more than a few left-handed batters was visible in the Indian team, with Washington Sundar, Axar Patel, and Shivam Dube forming the core of the middle order
Miscellaneous Highlights: Wanindu Hasaranga was ruled out of the remaining two fixtures due to a hamstring injury he suffered during the first ODI. Jeffrey Vandersay has been named as Hasarangaâ€™s replacement
Others: The pitch for the first game aided spinners considerably, and once the ball became soft, boundaries were hard to come by
The first ODI also gave a glimpse of what the team is looking to build under new coach Gautam Gambhir

The teams (from): India: Rohit Sharma (Capt.), Shubman Gill, Virat Kohli, K.L. Rahul, Rishabh Pant, Shreyas Iyer, Shivam Dube, Kuldeep Yadav, Mohd. Siraj, Washington Sundar, Arshdeep Singh, Riyan Parag, Axar Patel, Khaleel Ahmed and Harshit Rana. Sri Lanka: Charith Asalanka (Capt.), Pathum Nissanka, Avishka Fernando, Kusal Mendis, Sadeera Samarawickrama, Kamindu Mendis, Janith Liyanage, Nishan Madushka, Jeffrey Vandersay, Dunith Wellalage, Chamika Karunaratne, Maheesh Theekshana, Akila Dananjaya, Asitha Fernando, Mohamed Shiraz and Eshan Malinga
